rules: Rule1: If bar X has a license, then bar X operates legally.
Rule2: Whenever bar X has a major violation, bar X does not have a minor violation.
Rule3: In the event that bar X provides compliant alcohol service, bar X does not violate a condition.
Rule4: If bar X has proper documentation, then bar X provides compliant alcohol service.
Rule5: Should bar X have valid permits, bar X has proper documentation.
Rule6: Either bar X is under emergency closure, or if it is not the case that not having a license implies not serving alcohol, then bar X has conditional approval.
Rule7: Whenever bar X undergoes a routine check, a follow-up visit occurs for bar X.
Rule8: Bar X undergoes a routine check or bar X undergoes a complaint investigation.
Rule9: Provided that bar X undergoes a complaint investigation, bar X is not under emergency closure.
Rule10: In the event that bar X undergoes a follow-up visit, bar X is not under emergency closure.
Rule11: Whenever bar X undergoes a senior inspector review, bar X receives compliance certification.
Rule12: Either bar X undergoes a senior inspector review or bar X undergoes a junior inspector review.
Rule13: If bar X undergoes a junior inspector review, then provided that bar X does not operate legally, bar X does not operate illegally.
Rule14: In the event that bar X undergoes a final assessment, if bar X does not operate legally, then bar X does not operate illegally.
Rule15: Should bar X receive compliance certification, bar X undergoes a final assessment.
Rule16: Either bar X violates a condition or if bar X does not have a license, then bar X does not serve alcohol.
Rule17: If bar X passes inspection, then bar X meets the alcohol standard.
Rule18: In the event that bar X passes inspection, bar X has valid permits.
Rule19: Bar X passes inspection or bar X fails inspection.
Rule20: If bar X fails inspection, then bar X does not violate a condition.
Rule21: Provided that inspector report A is issued for bar X, then if bar X does not operate legally, bar X does not operate illegally.
Rule22: Either inspector report A is issued for bar X or inspector report B is issued for bar X.
Rule23: Whenever inspector report B is issued for bar X, then should bar X not operate legally, bar X does not operate illegally.
Rule24: If it is not the case that meeting the alcohol standard implies not violating a condition, then bar X has an ambiguous status.
Rule25: In the event that it is not the case that passing inspection implies not violating a condition, bar X has a contradictory finding.
Rule26: Should it not be true that passing inspection implies not violating a condition, then bar X does not have a contradictory finding.
Rule27: If it is not the case that not having a license and not serving alcohol implies a special exemption, then bar X has a minor violation.
Rule28: Provided that it is not the case that not having a license and not serving alcohol implies a special exemption, bar X has a major violation.
Rule29: Should bar X not have a license, bar X serves alcohol.
Rule30: Provided that bar X does not operate legally, bar X operates illegally.
facts: Fact1: It is not the case that bar X has an ambiguous status.
Fact2: Bar X does not have a special exemption.
Fact3: Bar X does not have conditional approval.
